title.bibl: Interview with Miss Eve Thomas, Secretary of the Russian Women's Club Rodina (Native Country).

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Interview with Miss Eve Thomas, Secretary of the Russian Women's Club Rodina (Native Country).

body.p: On Friday evening, being at the headquarters of the Russian-American Citizens' Organization, I had the opurtunity to pet from Miss Thomas, secretary of the Russian Women's Club Rodina (Kative Country) information about this your organization, by talk with Miss Thomas lasted half an hour. I leaned from her that follows:
The Russian Women's Club was founded on April 30, 1935. The club received has charter on February . The membership of the club consists of 22 full-fledged members, accurately their monthly dues.
The initiation fec is 50 cents; who monthly 25 cents.
Every summer the club arranges two pionics; in also gives every year several evening entertainments.

The object of the club Rodina is to give material and moral aid to
its members in cases of misfortune, disease, etc.
Pecuniary aid is given and its amount is defined the decision of the general assembly.
The fund of the club consists at present of $235.65.
Mrs. Mary is the president of the club. Miss Thomas is the secretary.
The Russian Club at the of Miss Eve Thomas.
